Class SmartTargetingEnemy

  • java.lang.Object
    • Enemy
      • SmartTargetingEnemy

  • public class SmartTargetingEnemy
extends Enemy
    This is a SmartTargetingEnemy class which is used to create an enemy that correctly follows the character around the map. This Class is an implementation of the A* algorithm which was done with the help of https://rosettacode.org/wiki/A*_search_algorithm#Java. and modified to work with the game.
    Creation Date: 25/11/19.
    Last Modification Date: 6/12/19.
    Version:
    1.6
    Author:
    Szymon Grzech (988065)

        private java.util.List<Node> freeCell

      • randomMove

        public void randomMove(Cell[][] gameMap)
        If the enemy didn't find a path to the character then it will move randomly.
        Parameters:
        gameMap - a map of Cells

      • move

        public void move(Character ch,
                 Cell[][] gameMap)
        Once this method is called then it runs the path finding algorithm and then if it is not empty then it will remove the first node from it as the first node is the initial location of the enemy. Then it will set the enemies coordinates (x,y) to the x and y of the node at index 0 if the path list is not empty.
        Specified by:
        move in class Enemy
        Parameters:
        ch - the Character, used to get the characters coordinates and is used to kill the character if they are on the same coordinates.
        gameMap - a 2D array of Cells on which the enemies move around.

      • findPathTo

        private java.util.List<Node> findPathTo(Character ch,
                                        Cell[][] gameMap)
        Finds the path to the character
        Parameters:
        ch - Character - the character to path towards.
        gameMap - Cell[][]- The map to use to find the path on.
        Returns:
        if no path exists then it will return null otherwise it will return the path to the character in a List of Nodes

        Parameters:

      • distance

        private double distance(int dx,
                        int dy,
                        Character ch)
        Calculates the distance between the character and the current node.
        Parameters:
        dx - direction x. either -1, 1 or 0.
        dy - direction y. either -1, 1 or 0.
        ch - character.
        Returns:

      • addNeighborsToFreeCellList

        private void addNeighborsToFreeCellList(Cell[][] gameMap,
                                        Character ch)
        Creates a new node that and if it satisfies all the conditions stated below that it will be added to the freeCell list and the counter g will be increased by 1. At the end of it, it will sort the list having the smallest counter on top, at index 0,
        Parameters:
        gameMap - 2D array of Cells
        ch - the character
